page.title: 14WEST FELTON HEALTH
page.content: EVERY TUESDAY THERE IS A SURGERY HELD IN THE VILLAGE, IN THE DOWNSTAIRS OF A HOUSE ON THE MAIN ROAD.THE SURGERY OPENS AT 2 P.M. AND IS USUALLY ATTENDED BY DR.F.TAYLOR FROM A PRACTICE IN OSWESTRY.THE SURGERY IS VERY BASIC BUT VERY USEFUL FOR THE OLD PEOPLE OF THE VILLAGE AND MOTHERS WITH YOUNG CHILDREN. THE DISTRICT NURSE IS NURSE ROBINSON WHO LOOKS AFTER THE OLD PEOPLE OF THE AREA AND ATTENDS MOTHERS WITH NEW BORN BABIES WHEN THEY RETURN FROM HOSPITAL. A MOBILE CLINIC SOMETIMES COMES TO THE VILLAGE TO GIVE INJECTIONS AGAINST FLU AND OTHER AILMENTS. THE SCHOOL NURSE ATTENDS THE SCHOOL REGULARLY TO CHECK FOR HEAD LICE AND THE CHILDREN ARE MEDICALLY EXAMINED WHEN THEY FIRST COME TO THE SCHOOL AND IN THE YEAR THEY ARE LEAVING.
